p: Later, the field of molecular phylogenetics fundamentally altered the basis of classification of organisms. In 2004, Walker et al., using the rbcL and trnL-F gene regions and broad sampling within Salvia, were the first to reveal that Salvia was non-monophyletic [ 11]. They found Perovskia, Dorystaechas, and Rosmarinus, as well as Mentha L., Origanum L., and Thymus L., and later also Meriandra and Zhumeria embedded within Salvia [ 11, 12].
